intro: Brimeura, commonly known as the false dandelion, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species that are native to various regions of South America. These plants typically have basal leaves that are lance-shaped and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in composite heads, and they bloom in the spring. Brimeura species are often found in grassy areas and are adapted to thrive in temperate climates.
